title: Helsinki Living Lab

author: Eero Holstila, Economic Development of the City of Helsinki

segmentation: I want to know everyone.
It's really a pleasure to be.
A speaker in Rome, specially in Rome.
This might be my bout 19th visit to Rome, but but maybe second time as a speaker here in Rome.
So it's a great day for me.
Coming from Helsinki and which is my task now is to give you an.
Example how is it organized in in in practice on city level or regional level?
My background is I earlier was.
Some kind of colleague of.
Mr. Tory.
Voice director lots?
Or it's an innovation agency.

I was earlier Managing Director Pullman Autumn, which is the rates and development agency for Innovations in Helsinki region where where not only the reason but also local universities and business community are involved as shareholders.
It's Ltd company common Atom where and I have long experience in cluster building.
Cluster building like like?
The previous example from France in finished knowledge center of Expertise program we have for years, man.
It's such kind of program, but the problem was we were successful.
OK, but the problem was how to in decorate how to get involved.
Those citizens end users and now that model is Helsinki Living Lab and I have a brochure to brochures here.
Only some on that table.
On Helsinki, living luck and Forum Virium Helsinki, but these are the two examples I'm going to tell you about that briefly.
Helsinki, you know from I come from the North, so I would say.
One of the edge cities of Europe in the middle of nowhere earlier now maybe one of the most dynamic economic regions in Europe.
Not only Helsinki, but the the Baltic Sea region, Stockholm St Petersberg, Baltic states, which is absolutely the growth tone of Europe just now.
And globally.
We are now realizing OK, Helsinki is the first stop coming from Beijing or Hong Kong or Mumbai to Europe.
It's from from.
Mumbai to New York.
It's shortest way.
We're Helsinki and so on.
The globalization has changed the map.
Earlier at it's now in the middle that and that's that map, which is the map of direct flights from Helsinki Airport.
Continental flights, they are mainly to China.
There are more than 60 direct flights weekly from Helsinki to Asia.
It means that OK, there we are really cooperating very keenly with Chinese people and for example, last week there was a launch event of this Helsinki living Lap in Helsinki.
Divorce not only Portuguese TV group but also big group from China.
It's really so many delegations weekly from China to helping it out on.
Innovation policy OK?
On the background, I have to tell you that in, in, in, in.
In finish case the local government is based on how to say consensus political consensus very much it mean and and trust of people on local government.
It's very Scandinavian fits and local income tax cities, municipalities, responsible for all kinds of services.
Not only infrastructure but services for.
Or citizens, or the schools almost are run by by by the city health care centers hospitals.
Deckadance and so on.
It means that it's very close contact to citizens all the time.
Daily public transport, of course, and so so our politicians or the City Council of Helsinki and also the same in surrounding municipalities.
The politicians have adopted this vision for Helsinki becoming a world class place for innovations, not only based on technology with their famous of.
Earlier this Nokia phenomena, but in the future more and more so we have to be able to combine technology knowledge and art, design, creativity, knowledge together.
So to be able to produce some added value for our products and services and to be competitive in this globalized sign up phenomena network.
And of course, on the bases learning learning schools.
Last week, OECD released a new pizza.
Study on the results of schools worldwide.
Finland again.
Number one.
The.
That's the base of course of low.
Also also innovation policy.
OK, call me not my voice earlier working for prepared two years ago or reach not innovation strategy.
Not only by pulling out, but all the shareholders of coming out on University people, business sector, people, local government people together, and they would.
There's four key messages in this law innovation strategy.
First one to universities.
You have to be more internationalized.
You have to be able to attract foreign students.
You have to be ranked top in local local rankings of universities.
You have to merge your capacities.
The second message to business sector.
You have to organize and that they are responsible on organizing test, burst and test bits and living laps for for new products and services.
Of course, together with other players and the third message to local government.
Also local government for example, city of Helsing surround money.
But we have to invest in R&D to develop our own activities like schools like healthcare.
Like public transport, it's not only to use the money, but to invest in R&D together with companies in context over 4.
Example living laboratories.
And that's the key.
Are hardcore of our.
Economic development strategy on the Helsinki and housing rates and nowadays to use this living lap methodology.
That the whole community, and which is the role of the local government here, is of course crucial for for us and for me.
OK, you see this.
The word open here several that open innovation.
Open and creative model of working based on trust.
That's that's most important that the cultural cultural how to say environment.
And also also all the other elements in in in local innovation, as they say in California, local Innovation Ecosystem Trust as a base for effective networking and collaborating.
That's that's what we are trying to be the best worldwide.
Also interviews.
I have two examples here.

The first one very briefly arabien run Ticats, which is which is a city district about 5 kilometers from the city centre, Helsinki, Helsinki University of Art and Design in the heart of this city district there was on old industrial area.
Now it's a big housing construction area and nowadays maybe about 10,000 inhabitants.
And this University and companies.
And it's by the city.
So that is really cheap and effective.
Access to Internet for everyone, not only the access, but also training for everyone for elderly people, for example to use it.
And it's a good place for companies to develop also new kind of services.
For example for elderly people in Arabien random.
So it's it's really living lab doing it with all these these.
Partners.
And the second fund, which I know even better is this forum virium Helsinki with Sister, which is a consortium of companies.
It's a company driven initiative, but my role from the City of Helsinki Point our mayor was asked to be chairman of the three cheering group of this forum.
Very embarrassing, but it's in practice, it's me and it's a wonderful place to see how big companies Nokia.
And and all these companies of software houses, telecommunications companies, and broadcasters like like Finnish Broadcasting Company and so on are doing it together.
How they need each other's knowledge and how they need also the public sector involved in this kind of.
R&D and innovation process ES I.
I realized that OK in the beginning.
Of course they asked the city of Helsinki supporting this consortium and we put half a million euro annually to support to establish office to manage development process of companies.
But that was not the key.
Most important thing from from company side.
What what they are expecting City to do is to offer our own activities our own city departments, schools, health care centers and public transport.
As places of warranty and development of services.
And that's what is now happening and which is the key priority in the city cities industrial?
Policy to encourage our city departments.
To take part of this this forum varium development projects.
And.
Of course it's very important for politicians to understand what living laboratory means, and it was a month ago, say a cookie from Helsinki Business School sitting here also and speaking after me.
She organized a brainstorming event for mayor of Helsinki and the Mayors Meeting.
What is really what?
What is this living lab in practice?
What sort we do, and it's not the only event our politicians have been so interested in this concept and it's very practical.
They also decided to establish Innovation Fund to help and encourage city departments to.
Participate this kind of project cause of course local politics.
Politicians in committees of for example healthcare or schools and so on.
They are not that eager to invest anything in the future, they are using the money for citizens.
But that's why we have this kind of local innovation fund in the in the.
Close to city government.
OK, this is an example, very practical.
What was done in kindergartens during this process.
It was one of the process is to provide personnel of kindergartens with camera phones and such kind of video could be seen by parents, families, grandparents, daily.
What's.
What was happening?
In the kindergarten for my children, and it was a company established during this process.
Connected Day now operating in Singapore in California, in Britain, in Helsinki are key indicators everywhere.
It's a good business model, so this is an exam.
Apple of Growth company origins from from forum.
Virium Helsinki.
Everyone can imagine that local public transport and and management of transport flows.
It's it's a very good place for doing something together with end users together.
People driving a car, getting some information on traffic just now to to his or her mobile device.
It's the several kinds of.
Projects and of course, the key here is the.
Traffic data.
Information on traffic situation which have been must be gathered somewhere and delivered after that.

As when standing at the bus stop, of course you are so eager to know when in fact the next bus number 75 or 57 is coming to this bus stop not only according to timetable, but in fact, and that's one of the key projects now in Helsinki, because every bus and every time is with wireless Internet now and it's easy to.
Place not needed those Galileo satellites, which you can do it you can.
You can get information to your mobile every bus stop.
In the near future.
OK, and this is the most important project from from the point of view of city government.
Healthy neighborhood.
How preventative health care information can be with for citizens Internet.
But also we are.
Mobile.
Devices.
OK, maybe the key message here is OK.
It can be organized globally.
The role of the city government in our Scandinavian cases is very important.
I don't know how is it here in Italy, for example, but it's not enough to do it local.
If we need networking.
European on European level.
It's this network of European living lights.
We are going to very soon but also.
Asian cities and European cities must do it together.
We have seen how eager really Chinese, the Beijing Shanghai and also show they are and they are really doing it already.
We have to do it together with them.
Also Helsinki might be hub between Asia and Europe also.
Thank you.
